Question 27 
[Geomatics Engineering : Theodolites & Plane Table Surveying]
Among the following statements relating the fundamental lines of a transit theodolite, which one is 
CORRECT?
(A) The line of collimation must be perpendicular to the horizontal axis at its intersection with the
vertical axis.
(B) The axis of altitude level must be perpendicular to the line of collimation.
(C) The axis of plate level must lie in a plane parallel to the vertical axis.
(D) The Vernier of vertical circle must read zero when the line of collimation is vertical. 
Ans. (A)
explanation_text:
Sol. 
Line of collimation must be perpendicular to horizontal axis.
Hence, the correct option is (A).
